description: The dataclass models (UserProfile, Order, Address) were updated to use camelCase keys in their to_dict() methods for API compatibility (user_id->userId, first_name->firstName, etc.), but the data_processor.py and order_processor.py modules still expect the old snake_case keys, causing KeyErrors when trying to access dictionary fields.
expected_fix: Update data_processor.py and order_processor.py to use the new camelCase keys from models.py: change 'user_id' to 'userId', 'first_name' to 'firstName', 'last_name' to 'lastName', 'phone_number' to 'phoneNumber', 'order_id' to 'orderId', 'total_amount' to 'totalAmount', 'order_status' to 'orderStatus', 'shipping_address' to 'shippingAddress', 'zip_code' to 'zipCode'.
complexity_factors: Need to examine models.py to see the new camelCase key names in to_dict() methods
Multiple classes need updates: DataProcessor and OrderProcessor
Multiple methods within each class access different keys
Nested dictionary issue with shipping_address containing zipCode
Need to update validate_user_data() required_fields list
Both user and order processing flows are affected
optimal_fix: In data_processor.py: Update all dictionary key accesses in process_user_profile(), extract_user_contact(), and validate_user_data() to use camelCase (userId, firstName, lastName, phoneNumber). In order_processor.py: Update all key accesses in process_order(), calculate_order_total(), get_shipping_info(), and get_order_summary() to use camelCase (orderId, userId, totalAmount, orderStatus, shippingAddress, and zipCode within address).
